ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Identities is a course about how individuals and groups formulate their identities according to a number of factors, and it involves everything from discussions of essentialism to analysis of the political salience of difference. It's a great course for anyone looking to deepen their understanding of how individuals and societies view themselves vis-a-vis the world around them.
I would recommend this class, especially to anyone who has ever had an identity crisis in their life.

I would definitely recommend this course to other students. The reason I would recommend it is because I have never seen so many bright individuals engaging so passionately in conversation as I have seen in this class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course taught me a lot about different ways of thinking in different departments, and also it made me question almost everything I have accepted to be "true." More than anything, this course made me feel like academia is worthwhile.

Personally, this course helped me tremendously precisely because I am in a process of transition in my academic and professional pursuits. I have gone through a period of doubting my interests and not knowing what I shall pursue in the future. This course really broadens my thinking in such a way that I feel more at ease with taking the time to explore bigger ideas and questioning assumptions.
